TopicTitle: [1.8.x] CapCom - Mission Control On The Go [v2.11] [11-1-2019]

Articles.Content:
no recent posts, thought i'd change that.

 

1.9 compatible?
@jebalicious It should be, I haven't heard otherwise and not much related to CapCom has changed since 1.8.
I can confirm, since 1.9.1 it works fine!

Hey everyone,

is it normal for CapCom to show contracts for undiscovered celestial bodies when using it together with the ResearchBodies mod? I've got a career mode going (using KSP 1.8.1+both DLC's) where only Kerbin, the Mun and Kerbol are known at the start and I just noticed after some hours into the savegame that CapCom started offering me two Satellite Contracts for Minmus although I haven't discovered it yet. However, when I go to the stock Mission Control building, the contracts for Minmus are not offered to me (as it should be).

It's definitely not game breaking behaviour, since I can simply ignore those contracts or go to Mission Control instead every once in a while to see a 'proper' list of contract offers... but does this happen to anybody else who's using CapCom together with RB?

Possible Bug Report (or maybe a plea for help)

Mod appears to function properly in 1.9.1(2788) but window is transparent in all screens.
I removed all mods but this one with no change.

I realize the mod is not tagged for use in 1.9, but you said you hadn't heard it wasn't working.
Perhaps I am missing some other mod that resolves this issue, please help.

I'm happy to provide any additional info you request.
Correction:  The error was mine.  I had it installed incorrectly (too many folders deep) and once this was fixed, it works just fine.   My apologies.

Hi, im on 1.9.1 and i can't accept or decline a contract from SPH or VAB. This isn't supposed to happen right? Could there be conflict between this mod and other mods?

From my experience it has always been the case. So I am only using that pop up to check what missions are available.

I can confirm that this does NOT work with 1.9.1 for everybody who is curious.

Spoiler

 

As soon as I click on the "globe" button I get this spammed to the log and the mod stops working: 


NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at CapCom.CapComWindow.currentContractHeader (System.Int32 id) [0x0024a] in <80de40b1f8e74a128bbaefacb0a4d707>:0 
  at CapCom.CapComWindow.DrawWindow (System.Int32 id) [0x00083] in <80de40b1f8e74a128bbaefacb0a4d707>:0 
  at CapCom.Framework.CC_MBW.DrawWindowInternal (System.Int32 id) [0x0000d] in <80de40b1f8e74a128bbaefacb0a4d707>:0 
  at UnityEngine.GUILayout+LayoutedWindow.DoWindow (System.Int32 windowID) [0x00077] in <fa6f9762ac624af092525d37c9d516c4>:0 
  at UnityEngine.GUI.CallWindowDelegate (UnityEngine.GUI+WindowFunction func, System.Int32 id, System.Int32 instanceID, UnityEngine.GUISkin _skin, System.Int32 forceRect, System.Single width, System.Single height, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style) [0x00077] in <fa6f9762ac624af092525d37c9d516c4>:0 
UnityEngine.DebugLogHandler:Internal_LogException(Exception, Object)
UnityEngine.DebugLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)
ModuleManager.UnityLogHandle.InterceptLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)

39 minutes ago, Gordon Dry said:

I can confirm that this does NOT work with 1.9.1

I can confirm that this mod mostly works in 1.10.1, however. The globe icon is buggy, indeed, but the spam stops as soon as I close the window or change the scene. I can't say I even noticed the globe button before

Edited September 15, 2020 by HansAcker
@HansAckerOkay, hmm. I was not able to close the window, I exited to the main menu which worked.

6 hours ago, Gordon Dry said:

@HansAckerOkay, hmm. I was not able to close the window, I exited to the main menu which worked.

A NullReference exception in the Update loop can probably interfere with GUI responsiveness.

I looked at it again and could only reproduce it at the first scene of a new career game, where "currentContract" is null in the GUI Window. It does not happen anymore when I reload the same game. That's probably got nothing to do with the KSP version. Apart from that little bug, I have not experienced any problems in 1.10.1.

@DMagic I see there's a null check in the function that allows a null contract on the records page but later on currentContract is referenced unprotected. Is there any special way to access these contracts or is that really just a quirk of starting a new game? For what's it worth, I fixed it locally by adding a check around the last GUI section:

Spoiler 

diff --git a/Source/CapComWindow.cs b/Source/CapComWindow.cs
index 04abc32..721bd0e 100644
--- a/Source/CapComWindow.cs
+++ b/Source/CapComWindow.cs
@@ -1064,6 +1064,8 @@ namespace CapCom
                                GUILayout.BeginVertical();
                                        GUILayout.Space(-16);
                                        GUILayout.Label(currentList == 3 ? "Record" : "Contract:", CapComSkins.headerText, GUILayout.Width(80));
+                                       if (currentContract != null)
+                                       {
                                                r = GUILayoutUtility.GetLastRect();
                                                r.y -= 4;
                                                r.x += 100;
@@ -1080,6 +1082,7 @@ namespace CapCom
                                                GUILayout.Label("Total Rewards:", CapComSkins.headerText, GUILayout.Width(260));
                                                GUILayout.Space(-6);
                                                sizedContent(currentContract.TotalReward.ToString("N0"), currentContract.TotalSciReward.ToString("N0"), currentContract.TotalRepReward.ToString("N0"), TransactionReasons.ContractReward);
+                                       }
                                GUILayout.EndVertical();
                        GUILayout.EndHorizontal();
                }

13 hours ago, HansAcker said:

It does not happen anymore when I reload the same game. That's probably got nothing to do with the KSP version.

Good to know fact - this makes it into a text file as a reminder.
Can anyone confirm the work in 1.12.3?

1 hour ago, Grem said:

Can anyone confirm the work in 1.12.3?

Yes, it works

@DMagic Not sure if you're still supporting this but I have a crash to report. Looks like it may be the same issue Gordon and Hans were discussing above.

From KSC overview, when viewing the "offered" contracts and there are none offered (maybe incidental, not sure) then clicking the world's first globe button causes NRE spam and everything below the top icons in the CapCom window is blank. CapCom window can be minimized, which stops the NRE spam. Opening CapCom again looks the same (mostly blank) and NRE spam starts again. It's repeatable after restarting KSP. I have a lot of other mods and it wasn't released for 1.12.5... but one more release would be great.
